meanings.definition: A pile of discarded materials or objects.
meanings.sent1: The old car parts were thrown onto the scrapheap behind the garage.
meanings.sent2: The junkyard was filled with a variety of items, creating a massive scrapheap.
meanings.sent3: When the kids found the broken toys, they decided to create a fort out of the scrapheap.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a scrapheap of clothes after she tried on multiple outfits.
meanings.sent5: The artist used the scrapheap of metal pieces to create a unique sculpture.

meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of something.
meanings.sent1: After the project was completed, they had to scrapheap the leftover materials.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to scrapheap the old machinery to make space for new equipment.
meanings.sent3: She had to scrapheap her old habits to make room for healthier choices.
meanings.sent4: The decision to scrapheap the outdated technology was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent5: In order to move forward, they had to scrapheap the past mistakes and start fresh.
